org.jamsim.ascape
Class MicroSimScape<D extends ScapeData>

java.lang.Object
  org.ascape.model.AscapeObject
      org.ascape.model.Agent
          org.ascape.model.LocatedAgent
              org.ascape.model.Cell
                  org.ascape.model.CellOccupant
                      org.ascape.model.Scape
                          org.jamsim.ascape.MicroSimScape<D>
Type Parameters:
D - a scape data class that defines data external to the scape for use by agents, and for loading agents.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable, Collection, EventListener, org.ascape.model.event.ControlListener, org.ascape.model.event.ScapeListener, org.ascape.model.space.Location, org.ascape.model.space.Node, org.ascape.model.space.SpaceContext, org.ascape.util.HasName, org.ascape.util.RandomFunctions
public class MicroSimScape<D extends ScapeData>
extends org.ascape.model.Scape

A Scape with micro-simulation input/output functions including base file loading, and output tables and external / global data tables that appear in the Ascape Navigator.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Oliver Mannion
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

MicroSimScape

public MicroSimScape(org.ascape.model.space.CollectionSpace space,
                     String name,
                     org.ascape.model.Agent prototypeAgent,
                     FileLoader loader,
                     D scapeData)
Creates a MicroSimScape and loads its agents from a base file. The location of the base file is stored in Preferences. If such a location does not exist, then the user is prompted for the base file location.

Parameters:
space - scape space
name - name of the scape. This will be the name of the dataframe if & when created in R.
prototypeAgent - the prototype agent so the navigator knows to show fields that have getter/setter methods.
loader - file loader object which provides preferences, an select file dialog, and output services
scapeData - a class that specifies data external to the scape and available for global access by agents via getScapeData(). This class also specifies how base agents are loaded (from file, database etc.)
Method Detail

isResultsToFile

public boolean isResultsToFile()
Get whether OutputDatasets for this scape should write their results to a file.

Returns:
true if this scape's OutputDatasets should write to a file.

Set whether OutputDatasets for this scape should write their results to a file.

Parameters:
outputToFile - write to file, or not

getScapeData

public D getScapeData()
Return the ScapeData object. This method allows agents to access the external/global scape data.

Returns:
scape data

getScapeRInterface

public ScapeRInterface getScapeRInterface()
Provide R interface.

Returns:
r interface

createScape

public void createScape()
Set the Navigator Tree Builder here. At this point the SwingEnvironment exists. We can't do this in Scape.createGraphicViews() because at that point the navigator has already been built (see the order of scape creation etc. in SwingRunner.openImplementation(String[], boolean). This method also overrides the scape implementation which removes all agents and replaces them with clones with parameter values of 0.

Overrides:
createScape in class org.ascape.model.Scape

getOutputTablesNode

public org.ascape.runtime.swing.navigator.NodesByRunFolder getOutputTablesNode()
Get the output tables node. Must be called after the Navigator tree has been created. This happens after createScape() but before Scape.createGraphicViews() is called.

Returns:
output tables node

addStatsOutput

public void addStatsOutput(OutputDatasetProvider provider)
Add a OutputDatasetProvider to the scape.

Parameters:
provider - provider

addDataFrameNode

public void addDataFrameNode(String name)
Add a data frame node to the navigator. Exits silently without creating a duplicate if a node of the same name already exists.

Parameters:
name - dataframe name in R

loadAgents

public void loadAgents()
Loads this scape with agents from a base file. The location of the base file is stored in Preferences. If such a location does not exist, then the user is prompted for the base file location. Calls setBasefile(String) to do the work.

The method must be called after construction and after the scape has been added to its parent, so that the scape variable is available.

getBasefile

public String getBasefile()
Expose base file as model parameter to Ascape.

Returns:
base file

setBasefile

public final void setBasefile(String bfileName)
Sets the base file to the specified file. The base file can be specified from the model parameters. If the base file doesn't exist, then a file chooser dialog is displayed to allow the user to select. If specified or selected, any existing agents are removed and the base file is loaded.

Parameters:
bfileName - base file to load
Throws:
IOException

getOutputDirectory

public final String getOutputDirectory()
Get the scape's output directory. Used for result output to files.

Returns:
output directory

setOutputDirectory

public final void setOutputDirectory(String strOutputDir)
Set the output directory for the scape.

Parameters:
strOutputDir - output directory

Return the agents of this scape as a caper dataset.

Returns:
casper dataset of this scape's agents.
Throws:
net.casper.data.model.CDataGridException - if problem creating dataset

addR

public ScapeRInterface addR(String dataFrameSymbol,
                            String startUpFilePrefsKey,
                            String rRunEndCommand,
                            boolean keepAllRunDFs)
                     throws IOException
Add R to this scape.

Parameters:
dataFrameSymbol - replacement symbol. When evaluating rRunEndCommand and commands during the creation of output datasets in ROutputMultiRun, this symbol is searched for and replaced with the current run's dataframe name.
startUpFilePrefsKey - if specified will look up this in the preferences and load the file into R.
rRunEndCommand - R command to run at the end of each run, or null.
keepAllRunDFs - flag to keep the dataframes from each run in R. This means creating each new dataframe with a unique name.
Returns:
scape R interface
Throws:
IOException - if problem looking up startUpFilePrefsKey
